How to guard the sense doors [sn35.120:5: When a mendicant sees a sight with the eyes, they don’t get caught up in the features and details.
When they hear a sound with their ears, they don’t get caught up in the features and details.
When they smell an odor with their nose, they don’t get caught up in the features and details.
When they taste a flavor with their tongue, they don’t get caught up in the features and details.
When they feel a touch with their body, they don’t get caught up in the features and details.
When they know a thought with their mind, they don’t get caught up in the features and details.
How to eat in moderation (a causal seque: Reflecting properly on the food that they eat
Eating only to sustain the body, to avoid harm, and to support spiritual practice
Putting an end to old discomfort and not giving rise to new discomfort
How to be committed to wakefulness (a ca: Practicing walking and sitting meditation by day
Continuing to practice walking and sitting meditation in the evening
Lying down in the lion’s posture in the middle of the night, mindful and aware, and focused on the time of getting up
Getting up in the last part of the night and continuing to practice walking and sitting meditation.
